caption.p: Clinical Associate Professor Jon Rampono AM

body.p: Several College Fellows have been recognised with Queen’s Birthday 2012 Honours for their achievements and contributions to society. The College congratulates and commends the following Fellows for their contribution to psychiatry and mental health:

Clinical Associate Professor Jonathan Rampono AM, Western Australia, was appointed a Member of the Order of Australia ‘for service to medicine as a psychiatrist, through support for women and newborn children, and to professional and social welfare organisations’. Clinical Associate Professor Rampono is the Head of Department of Psychological Medicine at King Edward Memorial Hospital in Perth and Chair of the Psychological Medicine Clinical Care Unit at the Women and Newborn Health Service of WA Health. Jon has also been President of the Australasian Marcé Society.

Dr Harry Alfred Derham OAM, Victoria, was awarded a Medal of the Order of Australia ‘for service to psychiatry, particularly in the field of eating disorders’. Dr Derham is an Honorary Senior Fellow at the Department of Psychiatry at the University of Melbourne and has been an active clinician at the Royal Melbourne Hospital and The Melbourne Clinic, whilst also maintaining a private practice. He has directed both institutions’ Eating Disorders Programs and was also a long-serving Medical Director, and Research and Ethics Committee Chair at The Melbourne Clinic. Dr Derham was awarded the RANZCP’s College Citation in 2009.

These awards acknowledge the many contributions psychiatrists are making to mental health services in Australasia and will hopefully raise awareness, increase knowledge and reduce stigma of mental illness.
